The impact this virus is having on our economy is devastating. I want you all to know that I start every meeting by asking what we’ll need to do to reopen our economy. I don’t want things to be like this a moment longer than necessary.

By 5 pm today, all recreational and entertainment facilities as well as any close-contact business – gyms, fitness centers, hair salons, nail salons – must close. That’s in addition to dine-in restaurants.

Thank you to everyone heeding our warnings and following the rules. Please remind everyone you know to do the same. Call your family and friends. Remind them: We can’t protect you if you don’t follow the rules. This isn’t a joke. These aren’t suggestions. This is serious.

I’m also requiring any business service personnel who can work from home to do so. If you need to maintain one or two critical employees to access files or open mail, that’s permitted. But the bottom line is that anyone who can work from home should.

Businesses that remain open must do the following: 
Keep 6 feet between customers; Require employees to practice appropriate hygiene measures, including frequent handwashing; Make sure employees who are sick stay home; & regularly clean & disinfect frequently touched surfaces.

I also want to remind everyone that the SBA approved our request for disaster declaration. RI businesses will now be able to access funds up to $2 million per business to help them meet their operating expenses.

That’s why, later today, I’ll sign an executive order directing all recreation and entertainment facilities to close their in-person operations. That includes theaters, cinemas, sporting events, bowling alleys and others.

I’m going to spell this out: You shouldn’t be visiting anyone in a hospital or nursing home. You shouldn’t be having a dinner party. You shouldn’t be having a large outdoor gathering. I’m grateful for RIers cooperation so far, but we need to be more aggressive.

Our biggest tool against this virus requires us to physically stay apart. No groups of 10 or more should be gathering. Period. How well we practice social distancing today will change the course of this virus weeks from now. We can’t protect you if you don’t follow the rules.
